moves.4. Bb5: In my opinion it's not a good move, for the bishop will have to move twice to gain nothing
moves.4... Qd5 5. Bxc6+ Qxc6: Th black queen is exposed but menaces g2 and h1.
moves.6. f3: It's probably the best move to eliminate the black queen's menace but it weakens white right wing in case of a castle and tend to block the g knight.
moves.7. d3: Efficient defense short term but white will have trouble to gain the center
moves.8. Nd2: Menacing e4 but blocking the dark square bishop
moves.9. Ne4: This move seems good to me (white doesn't want black to settle at the center) although the knight had to move twice (Black's developpement is well in advance now)
moves.10. Qe2: The only move to enable a long castle relatively quickly
moves.11. Be3: Preparing the long castel and menacing Bishop on c4
moves.11... Bxe4: To eliminate the menace on the c4 bishop which I don't want to move, for he is on an open diagonal, aiming at the center.
moves.12. fxe4 O-O 13. Bxc5: This seems a mistake to me, for now white has nothing on the center and the black queen will be well placed on c5, soon supported by a rook.
moves.13... Qxc5 14. O-O-O: The queen is on the king's file
moves.14... Rfd8: Settling on the semi open file.
moves.15. Nf3 Rac8: Both rooks on the semi open files
moves.16. Rd2 Qa5 17. Kb1 Rc6: Preparing to double the rooks or rook and queen on same file
moves.20... Qxa3 21. Kc1: ?? Mistake. This move leads to the lost of the h rook.
moves.22... Qxh1 23. Qe1 Qxg2+ 24. Qe2 Qxe2+: The trade favorise the one with the more material
moves.26. h3 Nf6: The knight must withdraw. Black's 25th move was useless and permitted white's pawn to advance
Not much to say about all those moves.
moves.34. Kf5: Mistake for it allows the black knight to set the king in check and win a pawn
moves.34... Nxd4+ 35. cxd4 Rd5xd4 36. Rc7: Blunder. White didn't see the mate. But there was, at this stage, little to do.

gameName: Walking the Walk and Learning to Run MT Part 4
